It's okay to have standards and not want someone that has had multiple partners in the past. But you've all gotta understand the majority of people have had a genuine first love relationship by the time they're 25, why wouldn't someone be intimate with the person they love? Of course first loves almost always never last, it's selfish to put the standard on women that they're easy if they've lost their virginity when the guy she's with has no negative label put on him. If you and a girl truly share feelings for each other, why does it matter? If you're a virgin it has weight because she is your first for everything, for her it has weight because she is choosing you after knowing what the end of a relationship/heartbreak feels like and wants to trust in you more than anyone else knowing that risk. Jealousy is part of our nature, but you all need to understand the difference of when it's healthy versus when it sows mistrust and anger. Stay strong boys.
